title: Queer 101
summary: In this workshop we will be defining all of the letters in the 'queer alphabet soup' and discussing what it means to be 'queer.' We will also discuss some of the etiquette within the queer community for both allies and LGBT+ members. This session will have plenty of time for a Q&A, and we will endeavor to answer all of your burning questions about the Queerdom

title: Personal Boundaries/Misogyny/Racism in Queer Spaces
summary: Despite our marginalized experience due to our sexual identity, queer spaces can often be a place where individuals with intersecting identities can feel unsafe. This session will be a discussion on ways to improve inclusivity of queer spaces, avoiding unintentionally harmful behavior, and negotiating personal boundaries in sexually liberated spaces.
presenter: Dylan Richardson, Jared Urbina, and Yasin (Ya-Ya) Fairley

title: Non-monosexual Representation in Media
summary: This session will examine the historical and modern portrayal of characters with non-monosexual identities across a variety of art forms.
presenter: Rowan Fae, Michael Timothy, and Tiffany Mankins

title: Intersectionality (Queer and....)
summary: This session will feature a panel of individuals whose marginalized and non-marginalized identities intersect and interact in ways that foster unique lived experiences and highlight the areas in which movements can improve inclusivity.  Come ask questions and hear the panelists speak on their identities and experiences.
presenter: Dree Wright, Jared Urbina, Yasin (Ya-Ya) Fairley, and Joni Weiss

title: Healthcare for Sexually Fluid People (Panel Discussion)
summary: This workshop will focus on some of the health challenges that LGBT+ people face, especially those which are more serious in the b+ community. We will also discuss some of the challenges in accessing proper healthcare as a b+ individual, and what patients and providers can do to bridge these barriers. We will talk about some of the LGBT+ affirmative healthcare professionals and groups throughout the valley. Panelists will include Dr. Rixt Luikenaar MD and...

title: Queer Writers Discussion
summary: Queer Writers will focus on the need for bi/pan/ace representation in literature, comics, and academic writing. More than just a Q & A, participants will engage in writing prompts and exercises that will help to engage and imagine a more intersectional writing world. Lists and links of good and bad representation will also be provided.

title: Self-care for Activists
summary: This session is a guided workshop with the facilitators and the audience on self-care in activism. Participants can expect to come away with strategies for balancing necessary self-care with their own needs for social and political activism. Come prepared to share your own ideas!

title: Dismantling Binary Thought Processes
summary: Beyond gender and sexuality, binaries exist across many facets of our existence and often restrict our belief of what is possible.  This workshop will question the usefulness of binary thinking, discuss ways of identifying problematic binary thinking, and brainstorm alternative approaches to seemingly dichotomous situations.

title: Sexual Fluidity and Disability
summary: This session will discuss concepts and common misconceptions surrounding disability in the B+ community.
